cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the northern Yucatan today, then turning north and accelerating toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana/Mississippi) by late Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Buras, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch and Tropical Storm Watch limited to the Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico; none issued for the U.S. Gulf Coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico including Cozumel; Tropical Storm Warning south of Tulum to Punta Allen and west of Dzilam to Progreso; no U.S. coastal warnings yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact expected from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Alabama coast; minor fringe impacts possible western Gulf including upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a small 4% chance of experiencing tropical-storm-force winds; sustained gales are unlikely at Texas City, TX.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat indicated for the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Any rainfall associated with Zeta at Texas City is expected to be light and well below flooding thresholds.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated for port operations at this time.
